image.altText: Pope waves from wheelchair in white with red cardinals behind him

props.synopsis: The Vatican confirms the death of Pope Francis, who sat at the head of a church encompassing more than 1 billion worshippers worldwide. Follow live.

title.children: World pays tribute to Pope Francis

image.altText: Easter Sunday at St. Peter's Square at the Vatican 1

props.synopsis: The death of Pope Francis has set in motion the centuries-old process of electing a new pope.

title.children: What happens when a pope dies?

image.altText: A man with white religious clothes sits smiling with colourful feathers on his head

props.synopsis: Catholics across the world are pausing to remember the life of Pope Francis. And the pontiff's death is being keenly felt in the Asia-Pacific region, where he leaves a significant legacy.

title.children: 'My king': Catholics across the Asia-Pacific mourn Pope Francis

image.altText: A close-up of a man wearing a baseball cap stands at a window looking out. He has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A former ASIO spy is breaking his cover to expose the activities of a notorious preacher at the centre of Australia's resurgent pro-Islamic State network.

title.children: Undercover agent who infiltrated Sydney's pro-IS network has a warning for Australia

image.altText: Pete Hegseth scratches the right of his forehead near his hairline with his left thumb as he sits at a table near a man.

props.synopsis: After another Signal controversy, there is mounting pressure on US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth and reports of "dysfunction" and "mass chaos" inside the Pentagon.

title.children: 'Chaos' and 'dysfunction' reign inside Pete Hegseth's Pentagon

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: A US-China trade war is a battle neither side can win. It's more a question as to the amount of pain either country can endure and which will emerge with the least damage.

title.children: Trump could be fighting a losing battle in a US-China trade war

image.altText: Anthony Albanese getting out of a car.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese, Peter Dutton, Adam Bandt and David Littleproud express their condolences following the death of Pope Francis. Follow live.

title.children: PM, Dutton, Bandt and Littleproud express condolences after pope's death

image.altText: A graphic showing Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton imposed over images of a wheelchair, NDIS logo, money and housing

props.synopsis: On the eve of a new parliament, these are three areas disability advocates want addressed, write Evan Young and Nas Campanella.

title.children: Three big disability issues the next government needs to address

image.altText: A ballot box on a gradient background. Above it is a puffy blue question mark.

props.synopsis: Need a refresher on voting ahead of the federal election? We've got everything you need to know.

title.children: You can now vote in the federal election. Here's how to do it

image.altText: A close up composite photo of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese at the debate.

props.synopsis: Channel Nine will be broadcasting tonight's debate between the leaders of the Coalition and Labor parties.

title.children: Albanese and Dutton face another leaders debate tonight. Here's how to watch it

image.altText: A crashed car on a stretch of highway. Ared car nearby and a fire truck.

props.synopsis: A woman has been killed and a man shot after a string of alleged carjackings on the Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Woman dead and man shot in string of alleged carjackings

image.altText: A woman with red hair sits at her home computer.

props.synopsis: "Return to office" demands appear to have peaked, with research noting a fall in mandates for a certain amount of in-person days. Five years from the start of the COVID pandemic, remote and hybrid models of working are now normalised.

title.children: Working from home not going anywhere as in-office mandates fall, survey finds

image.altText: Piles of reddish-brown iron ore at Rio Tinto's Cape Lambert port facility in the Pilbara.

props.synopsis: Iron ore is the lifeblood of Western Australia's economy, but the industry has a new competitor in the form of the Simandou mine in Guinea, holding one of the largest untapped high-grade deposits in the world.

title.children: Could WA's golden goose be under threat from a giant iron ore deposit in Guinea?

image.altText: A shot of Queensland Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Queensland taxpayers have footed a $162,500 recruitment bill for the government to hire four top bureaucrats.

title.children: Queensland government spends $162k recruiting four bureaucrats

image.altText: GettyImages-2210645632

props.synopsis: Geelong hangs on for a thrilling seven-point win against Hawthorn, with focus now shifting to the match review panel after Conor Nash knocked out Cats forward Gryan Miers.

title.children: Renewed calls for AFL send-off after high shot rocks Easter Monday classic

image.altText: a person hold a bible from Gallipoli which is going on display at the Anzac Memorial in Sydney

props.synopsis: A young soldier was carrying a Bible when he was hit by shrapnel at Gallipoli — it's among the items on show in Sydney to mark 110 years since the ill-fated landing.

title.children: Personal items tell the story of Gallipoli bravery and 'living hell'

image.altText: Close up of Jenny Kee with red-rimmed glasses and black print outfit, smiling widely.

props.synopsis: At 78, Jenny Kee feels so passionately about her fashion creations that she refers to them as her "children". And while she says her career is slowing down, the evidence for that is hard to find.

title.children: Influential Australian fashion designer Jenny Kee on 'letting go'

image.altText: Corey Toole runs the ball against Moana Pasifika.

props.synopsis: Brumbies coach Stephen Larkham is convinced Corey Toole is ready to play Test rugby, and the lightening quick winger is continuing to build a case to be picked for the Wallabies.

title.children: Unsung Brumbies hero putting Wallabies' selectors on notice

image.altText: Albanese stands in front of medicare sign with half a smile on his face

props.synopsis: With first votes to be cast tomorrow the parties have released how-to-vote cards. Albanese says Labor isn't getting complacent while Clive Palmer is hoping to inflict pain on both major parties.

title.children: Newspoll has Labor further ahead but Albanese says election is anyone's to win

image.altText: John Evans and Bree Rizzo hold up the respective men's and women's Stawell Gift trophies.

props.synopsis: The hotly anticipated showdown between Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy at the Stawell Gift did not eventuate, while John Evans and Bree Rizzo won the respective men's and women's finals.

title.children: Gout and Kennedy miss out at Stawell Gift as Evans and Rizzo win finals

image.altText: A grey feral cat looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Research tracking released bilbies and bettongs in remote SA has found feral cats are their biggest killer.

title.children: Feral cats killing more native animals than previously thought

image.altText: A woman nurses a baby wombat wrapped in a blanket.

props.synopsis: The number of sick or injured wildlife is rising in Victoria, but the number of people able to help them is rapidly decreasing and carers say animals are being "left to die".

title.children: Wildlife carer spending $10k a year says cost is driving volunteers out

image.altText: Ted Mulry Gang

props.synopsis: Every week, Sunday night six o'clock, Australians settled down to watch a show so famous even King Charles III made an appearance.

title.children: One in five Australians used to watch this show. Now clips thought lost forever have been found

image.altText: A woman with tied back blond hair smiles and holds up a custom blue and white patterned soccer ball with a wall of balls behind

props.synopsis: It was the aligning of two cultural phenomena — the 2023 Women's World Cup and social media platform TikTok —  that turned Emily Hassell from casual football fan into custom soccer ball maker.

title.children: How the Matildas and TikTok inspired this fan to make custom soccer balls

image.altText: An illuminated light box on a quiet street that reads BBQ Chickens take away

props.synopsis: From our coffee addiction to a weekend pub tradition, some of the simple pleasures many Australians have taken for granted now feel like luxuries. But if patrons can no longer afford to visit the pubs and cafés we love, there may be something bigger at stake.

title.children: 'The math isn't mathing': Middle-class consumption now feels closer to luxury

image.altText: Shipping containers in multiple colours sit in a yard with freight trains parked behind them on a bright sunny day

props.synopsis: China has warned countries against striking a broader economic deal with the United States at its expense, ratcheting up its rhetoric in a spiralling trade war between the world's two biggest economies.

title.children: China warns countries against negotiating trade deals with the US at its expense

image.altText: Mollie O'Callaghan gets ready to start

props.synopsis: Mollie O'Callaghan beats out a stacked field to win the 100m freestyle title, as fellow Olympic medallists Cam McEvoy and Elijah Winnington claim gold on day one of the Australian Open Swimming Championships.

title.children: Mollie O'Callaghan faces down 'most difficult period' to win gold

image.altText: Frank Carbone

props.synopsis: The vast majority of new arrivals in Australia end up in our capital cities. Experts and locals weigh in on how it's affecting our housing crisis.

title.children: The mayor of this Aussie suburb says it's 'full' as the migration debate heats up

image.altText: Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri on the Jeddah podium

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri becomes the first Australian to lead Formula 1 drivers' championship in 15 years, passing Max Verstappen on the first corner en route to victory in Saudi Arabia.

title.children: 'He forced me off': Red Bull unhappy as penalty hands Piastri Saudi win

image.altText: Kaison Greaves

props.synopsis: The number of coastal deaths over the Easter long weekend has risen after a nine-year-old boy died at South West Rocks on Sunday.

title.children: Family's 'hearts are broken' over death of 'amazing big brother' off NSW beach

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene.

props.synopsis: A 53-year-old man will face court today, charged with Ms Griffin's murder after her body was found in a creek on the NSW Central Coast last month.

title.children: Man faces murder charge over 19yo Audrey Griffin's death

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman signs a document while sitting on a park bench next to a man.

props.synopsis: A litigation funder will pocket one-sixth of a $180 million settlement in a historic Northern Territory stolen wages class action while the Aboriginal workers themselves will get "at least $10,000" each.

title.children: Judge critical of law firm behind $180m stolen wages class action

image.altText: A woman crying

props.synopsis: One commander has been dismissed as a result of an investigation into the killing of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency workers, who were found in a shallow grave a month ago.

title.children: Israel says killing of Palestinian medics the result of 'poor night visibility'

image.altText: He has curly grey hair, stubble and wears a green and blue striped jumper.

props.synopsis: The Anangu built one of the nation's most remote communities after nuclear bombs were tested on their country. But they face profound challenges amid extreme weather and rising costs.

title.children: Faced with extremes, the Spinifex People are being pushed to the limit
